intro: Eriocaulon asteroides, commonly known as the star-shaped spikerush, is a member of the Poales order and belongs to the family Eriocaulaceae. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces tiny, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and seasonally flooded areas. Eriocaulon asteroides is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
